subject: Data
title: Data Brokers: Who's Selling Your Information?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Data Brokers: Who's Selling Your Information?.

hook.text: Companies you've never heard of know your income, health conditions, political views, and daily commute.

buildup.text: Data brokers collect personal information from public records, apps, and purchases, then sell it to anyone.

discovery.text: The data broker industry generates $200 billion annually â€” and most people don't know it exists.

twist.text: Unlike tech companies, most data brokers aren't regulated because they have no direct relationship with you.

climax.text: Some brokers sell lists like 'people with dementia' or 'financially vulnerable families.' It's legal.

punchline.text: Your data has a price. You just don't get paid.

quiz.question: What do data brokers do?
options: Collect and sell personal information to third parties
